snippet: Since taking over the United States Chamber of Commerce in 1997, Thomas Donohue has transformed the organization into a powerful ally of tobacco.

byline.contributor: Douglas Dalby contributed reporting from Dublin, and Alain Delaquérière contributed research from New York.

abstract: Thomas J Donohue, United States Chamber of Commerce chief executive and staunch supporter of tobacco industry, is heading campaign to convince countries around world to roll back antismoking legislation; leader's path to power, which has transformed Chamber into largest US lobbying group, is chronicled.
lead_paragraph: Since taking over the United States Chamber of Commerce in 1997, Thomas Donohue has transformed the organization into a powerful ally of tobacco.

headline.print_headline: Big Tobacco’s Powerful Friend in Washington
headline.main: Big Tobacco’s Staunch Friend in Washington: U.S. Chamber of Commerce
